content: @Luke McCormick - We talked about having a R2W meeting on Tuesday at 12:00pm (Pacific). Are we still on? Should I add it to the official BackdropCMS calendar?
Yes, let’s do it!

I created a meeting agenda and set up a Zoom meeting.

https://bit.ly/3gA5xKN

2020/12/08 Backdrop Ready-to-wear Initiative - Meeting #3
Ready-To-Wear #3 agenda - Dec 8th, 2020 Today’s R2W agenda: https://bit.ly/3gA5xKN | “Zoom” link: https://bit.ly/3qzJo3D Goal: Make it easy for non-coders/non-designers to create attractive Backdrop sites TODO What have Current References Notes: Meeting #1 Notes: Meeting #2 Forum Post: h...
I'm surprised by how much stuff there is in the agenda, from the last meetings. @StPaulTim , thanks for pulling that together.
I'm a little nervous that if we stick to the agenda, we won't get anywhere (because we'll be overwhelmed by possiibilities. Or at least, I'm worried that I will be.)
I just copied the last agenda and left the old content. I assumed we would make our own new agenda during meeting.
I did not mean we should stick to that agenda.
Works for me. I have a concept, I guess I'll just talk it out during the meeting...which I'll head to now.

Zoom link - not the usual.
https://bit.ly/3qzJo3D
http://ready2wear.simplo.site/
@Luke McCormick - https://www.triplo.co/blog/color-module-backdrop-cms
Didn't have time yesterday. Did you record the meeting or wrote up some notes?

Sorry @Olaf Grabienski, the meeting wasn't recorded ... @StPaulTim took some very minimal notes on the agenda, but both Tim and @Luke McCormick stayed on the line after the call, and if I understood correctly the intention was to add some further notes at some point.

I intended to record the meeting, but forgot. The notes are not that useful.

I would watch this weeks Outreach meeting for a good summary of what we talked about.
I have really lost my understanding of the point of this initiative TBH. What are we doing? Where we heading?
@docwilmot in short, the goal is to provide something like Drupal Gardens, where people can try Backdrop themes, to see how their site could look like. ...we've made some progress.

docwilmot in short, the goal is to provide something like Drupal Gardens, where people can try Backdrop themes, to see how their site could look like. ...we've made some progress.

this is the official decision?

This is a summary @docwilmot ...the official issue is https://github.com/backdrop/backdrop-issues/issues/4436 which at its current state says:

Goal: People should be able to use backdrop without needing to know how to create or modify a theme.

Initiative: Theme development should not be necessary to use Backdrop CMS · Issue #4436 · backdrop/backdrop-issues
Copied from: https://forum.backdropcms.org/forum/official-initiative-theme-development-should-not-be-necessary-use-backdrop-cms Goal: People should be able to use backdrop without needing to know h...

...we also have:

  • a forum post for discussions for people w/o GitHub accounts: https://forum.backdropcms.org/forum/official-initiative-ready-wear-theme-development-should-not-be-necessary-use-backdrop-cms
  • a repo where some work is happening: https://github.com/backdrop-ops/demo
  • an "unofficial" demo site where some work has happened: http://ready2wear.simplo.site/
backdrop-ops/demo
example backdrop site with content and configuration - backdrop-ops/demo

if this is where this has gone to, its disappointing. if I recall correctly, and I think I do, from reading the original issues, the original need came from recognizing that we don't have good themes in backdrop contrib OOTB. i had hoped we'd somehow collaborate to change that.

@docwilmot the hope is that by having that demo site available:

  • contrib theme authors will test their themes there and makes sure they work as expected
  • members of the community and existing users of themes will be able to confirm issues (that are not specific to their site) and report them to the theme issue queues (by pointing to a demo page of the r2w demo site with the issue)
  • potential Backdrop adopters can use that site to see what their site will look like
  • we could link to the r2w demo site from theme nodes in b.org, so that instead of screenshots (or in addition to them), people will be able to see a "live" version of the theme, along with some dummy content
    Don't you think that that's useful?

i had hoped we'd somehow collaborate to change that.

...yes, that's on the to-do list too.

An early holiday present for our R2W initiative - a new theme. Work in progress... https://github.com/backdrop-contrib/snazzy

backdrop-contrib/snazzy
Theme for Backdrop CMS. Contribute to backdrop-contrib/snazzy development by creating an account on GitHub.
Thanks @indigoxela ++
indigoxela go team. (Karma: 10)
...is it created from scratch, ported, or converted?
It's created from scratch - I felt like making a "split header" thing might be fun.
Looks nice, and I don't think that there's any other similar to it from the existing ones :+1:

I took a shot at adding a block to SwitchTheme that shows all available themes in a UL:

https://github.com/cellear/switchtheme

cellear/switchtheme
Provides blocks to allow a user to switch their active theme - cellear/switchtheme
image.png
